A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Overly-witty/jokey winking-at-the-audience self-aware snarkfest determined to every 3 minutes remind you it's 2017 and not a galaxy far\, far away\, focus-group generated cast of perfectly diverse millennials of whom the protagonist is a flawless featureless demi-god\, plot variously a nonsensical reboot of the originals aggressively stripped of soul and replaced with calculated nostalgia or otherwise stuffed with contrived \"twists\" like Han's stupid\, undignified death at the hands of a Hot Topic employee\, art style is \"extended CGI cut-scene\" that manages to feel both weightless and fake while killing the gritty 70's motifs and any sense of temporal continuity between the two trilogies\, in general a generic 201X Hollywood Blockbuster (Snark-CGI-Nostalgia golden ratio) adapted from a 6th grader's fan fiction.  Next up\, Robert Downey Jr. leads the Rebel Alliance to victory by cracking jokes to Darth Evil\, Rey is revealed to be the film's writer in a surprise meta-twist.
